problem.title: CheckPoint: Angular Collision
problem.p: A rod of mass M and length 2D rests on a horizontal frictionless surface contained in the (x,y) plane. A small block of mass M is attached to one of the ends of the rod. Another small block, also of mass M, slides along the surface at velocity v directed perpendicular to the rod. The sliding rod strikes the end of the rod as shown and remains attached to it. As a result, the rod with the attached blocks begins to move along the horizontal surface. The figure shows a top view of the described situation at the instants before and after the moving block is attached to the rod. (Gravity is into the screen).
Part A. Find the speed u of the center of the midpoint of the rod after the collision.
Part B. Find the angular speed of rotation of the rod about its midpoint after the collision.
